Package de.ikor.sip.foundation.core.declarative.connector

Interface InboundConnectorDefinition<T extends org.apache.camel.model.OptionalIdentifiedDefinition<T>>

Type Parameters:
T - Type that is required by the inbound connector to define the endpoint. This is usually a RoutesDefinition.
All Superinterfaces:
ConnectorDefinition, IntegrationScenarioProviderDefinition, Orchestratable<ConnectorOrchestrationInfo>
All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericInboundConnectorBase, RestInboundConnectorBase, SoapOperationInboundConnectorBase
public non-sealed interface InboundConnectorDefinition<T extends org.apache.camel.model.OptionalIdentifiedDefinition<T>> extends ConnectorDefinition, IntegrationScenarioProviderDefinition
Definition of an inbound connector, which is a specialization of a ConnectorDefinition that initiates an integration call for the integration scenario the connector belongs to.

The inbound connector is responsible for defining the endpoint that initiates the integration call. The endpoint is defined by the defineInboundEndpoints(OptionalIdentifiedDefinition, EndpointProducerBuilder, RoutesRegistry) method.

Adapter developers should not implement this interface directly, but rather extend one of the inbound ConnectorBase subclasses and annotate it with @InboundConnector.

See Also:
  • ConnectorDefinition
  • GenericInboundConnectorBase
  • RestInboundConnectorBase
  • InboundConnector

  • Method Details

    • defineInboundEndpoints

      void defineInboundEndpoints(T definition, org.apache.camel.builder.EndpointProducerBuilder targetToDefinition, RoutesRegistry routeRegistry)
      Defines the inbound endpoint(s) for the integration scenario the connector belongs to.
      Parameters:
      definition - Type that is required to initiate the endpoint.
      targetToDefinition - Target that the inbound endpoint should be connected to (e.g. the final ProcessorDefinition.to(EndpointProducerBuilder) in a RouteDefinition).
      routeRegistry - Route registry that must be used to register routeIds for the inbound endpoint(s).
